comment: I've downloaded 3 different watch face apps. Play store shows all three installed, but I can't find them on my phone.  Please help. Edit... I increased my rating to 3 stars because of the developers response to my problem.  Yet... I shouldn't have even had the problem. Edit... Installed and found only two faces available... Where's the ability to create faces?

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Dave!

All of our watch faces are accessible through the Android Wear App under the "More Watch Faces" button at the top of the Android Wear App home screen. There you'll find all of the available watch faces. Tap the button to select the face and it will appear. Hope this helps!

Thank you for your time,
ustwo
wearissues@ustwo.com

title: Missing?  -edit x2

comment: please help

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hello, Yaseen!

All of the customization of Face Maker is only available on the watch. Simply long press on the wearable, select the gear icon beneath the watch face icon, and begin the customization process.

If you have any further questions, please, hit us up at wearissues@ustwo.com

Thank you for your time,
ustwo

title: Simple and beautiful

comment: 5 stars for the 'whats new' story.

author: Gianflavio Gordillo
comment: Great designs
title: Awesome

comment: I've spend a lot of money on different customisable watchfaces and almost always I wasn't happy with them. They're usually offering plenty of options, but overall design and quality wasn't that good. Ustwo Face Maker is different - simple, good looking and free. I wish there was more watchface designs though.
title: Simplicity at it's finest

author: Nikola Torbica
comment: When i disable ambient mode and when i hold up my wrist so i check time watch turns on but there is little annoying bug which shows ambient type mode face for like 0.2 seconds and then it shows normal face.. It seems like it needs more of optimizations around that and when you fix that bug I'll gladly give 5 stars!

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Nikola!

This behavior is part of the system and not specific to our watch face. It transitions from ambient to interactive when the watch wakes and can be noticed on other watch faces as well. Hope this helps!

Thank you for your time,
ustwo

title: Very good simple watch face but..

author: Jarl Wijman
comment: not using an app that doesn't show up with the rest of the watch faces AND is very unstable. even with stability fixed I won't use this, unless watch faces can be picked through the Android Wear app.

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Jarl!

The decision to have the customization live on the watch itself came from our belief that the platform will be heading in that direction. If you are facing stability issues, please hit us up on wearissues@ustwo.com for assistance. We'd love to help!

Thank you for your time,
ustwo Wear Team

title: nope

author: Zoran Antić
comment: Great Start! Works OK with Moto 360 first gen, ambient mode too. App takes some time to install and start but after that everything works OK. Looking forward for new faces!

author: James Conigrave
comment: Wish tick marks didn't disappear in ambient mode.

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, James!

Our decision to not include tick marks came from wanting to achieve a true black watch face look in ambient mode as possible. Hope this helps answers your concern!

Best,
ustwo Wear Team

title: Ambient mode lacking

author: Fas Jackson
comment: Needs an Android app to make the faces. Doing this on the watch is a horribly clunky, slow and unstable way to do this. It should be more like watchmaker. No need to reinvent the wheel when it's already perfect. Uninstalled. Horrible.

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Faslane!

The decision to have the customization live on the watch itself came from our belief that the platform will be heading in that direction. If you are facing stability and performance issues, please hit us up on wearissues@ustwo.com for assistance with your device information. We'd love to help!

Thank you for your time,
ustwo Wear Team

title: Nope

author: Adam Sobotka
comment: I like other faces from ustwo, they even published great framework for creating watch faces, but this is not good, there are way better customizable faces.
title: Mediocre

author: Andrew Rosiclair
comment: Using the watch to customize the watch face is a clunky and lengthy process. Have both a phone app and on watch settings as most watch faces do please.
title: There needs to be a phone settings app

author: Frank
comment: Interesting app but it just needs a few more options to make it a must have.  For example: add an option for Roman numerals, and an option for pure white faces and more hands. Add an option for a white ambient mode for watches with bigger batteries. Finally,it needs its own app rather than simply making changes on the watch.

author: Jack Karimi
comment: Very nice watch faces. However, we are quite limited with customisation. More options, especially with background colour, would be great

title: not a good experience

author: Diego UrqEsc
comment: i repeat do not download this app . when I installed it my moto 360 v2 turned off and now Im not able to use it and when I try to turn it on it just vibrates but display is not longer working

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Link!

We are 99.999% certain that the architecture of Android Wear, and our app, precludes this as a possibility. It would not cause a system-level issue. Sorry that this happened. We recommend that you contact your service provider for further assistance as an operating system failure of this sort is likely under warranty.

Best, 
ustwo

title: Do NOT

author: Russell Harper
comment: Love love love your watch faces, but why don't you allow notifications in ambient mode?

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Russell!

Glad to hear you love using the watch faces! The reason we do not allow notifications in ambient mode is because there is no white in the peek card, just white text. Therefore the white text would conflict with the markers/numerals selections and anything else that would appear behind the text making it appear messy. 

Best,
ustwo

author: samir khoury
comment: No good for me

reply.author: ustwo
reply.content:
Hi, Samir!

The reason we do not allow notifications in ambient mode is because there is no white in the peek card, just white text. Therefore the white text would conflict with the markers/numerals selections and anything else that would appear behind the text making it appear messy. Hope this helps understand our decision behind it!

Best,
ustwo
